results.title: Roses are red
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Robert Connolly and Marcella Hayward
results.brief_description: Joy and Di are two women on a mission, but Di wonders whether Joy has got what it takes. Joy wonders if she has got what it takes. After all, it’s not easy being a parking cop. Brian thinks it’s even tougher being a flower seller - and the last thing he needs is a parking ticket. Starring David Wenham (‘Lord of the Rings’), Kris McQuade and Jacqueline McKenzie. Original format 35mm.

results.title: Nightride
results.creator_credit: Della Churchill, Martin Murphy and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A masked killer, a series of brutal murders, a confined space, a resourceful young hero and a terrifying confrontation. Nightride cleverly condenses the conventions of the horror film established in Halloween and Friday the 13th into a suspenseful 11 minute film.

results.title: A Horse with stripes
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Andrew Ross and Andrew O'Sullivan
results.brief_description: Manicured lawns…immaculate houses…clean streets…but beneath this highly desirable exterior lurks the desperation of the bored, the scared, the paranoid and the violent. And when the tranquil suburban life of the Goldings and the Bates deteriorates into chaos, they choose not to speak about it. Winner of Silver Hugo, Best short drama, Chicago International Film Festival, USA, 1991.

results.title: The Drover's wife
results.brief_description: From Henry Lawson via Russell Drysdale - the Australian myth of The Drover’s Wife retold from a different perspective. Story retold by Murray Bail. Based on Henry Lawson’s original story and inspired by Drysdale’s painting of the same name this film explores women’s invisibility in our cultural history. It uses a wide variety of commentators and visual and literary sources, and is positive and free of professional jargon. Cast features Martin Vaughan. Won Silver Award and Special Award for Acting in the General Category at the AFI Awards.
results.description: From Henry Lawson via Russell Drysdale - the Australian myth of The Drover’s Wife retold from a different perspective. Story retold by Murray Bail. It uses a wide variety of commentators and visual and literary sources, and is positive and free of professional jargon. Cast features Martin Vaughan. results.title: Amelia Rose Towers
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Ashley Scarlett, Nicole Sorby and Jackie Farkas
results.brief_description: If, as a child, you were picked last for a team and sought as your refuge a wish or a dream. If you ever felt lonely, peculiar or blue, then Amelia Rose Towers is a bit like you! True! Amelia Rose Towers, ‘whose initials spell ART’, faces off against an adversary whose initials spell MAN, after passing through surrealist chambers and screens offering images of a personal identity that can never be reconciled. A story of juggling variables of reality of self and other; of space, time and perceptions; of the art of science and the science of art but it is also a story of hope, love and courage.

results.title: Your brother, my tidda
results.creator_credit: Kathy Sport, Kelrick Martin and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
“Coming out” to family, living with HIV and religion - some of the life changing situations faced by two Aboriginal gay men, Sam Barsah and Aaron Clark.
Sam has “come out” twice; first to his family about his sexuality and then about his HIV status. Like other indigenous gay men, he wants respect and understanding and only now, almost ten years later, does he feel able to speak openly about his story. Aaron is young and relatively new to Sydney. Growing up as a Jehovah’s Witness, he is looking for an alternative gay Christian group.
Using a contemporary blend of semi-observational filming, photos and animation, this short documentary about race and sexuality describes two very different stories of being Aboriginal and gay.
N.B. “Tidda” is an Aboriginal word for “sister”.

results.title: You dust mite be next
results.creator_credit: Darlene Johnson, Chris Aronsten, Kate Reidl, Jane Keneally and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A docudrama about the evil little dust mite that plagues the world using up close and personal microscopic images, horror tales from victims and a biology lesson from experts Dr Ewan Tovey and Michael Morris.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Darlene Johnson, Chris Aronsten, Kate Reidl, Jane Keneally and AFTRS
results.description: A docudrama about the evil little dust mite that plagues the world using up close and personal microscopic images, horror tales from victims and a biology lesson from experts Dr Ewan Tovey and Michael Morris.
